Breaking Down Relics.name: Breaking Down Relics
Breaking Down Relics.description: Breaking Down Relics Many Relics can have their magical essence broken in exchange for Gloom Gems. However, doing so irrevocably destroys the item, and it can never be returned to its original form.

Relic Capacity.name: Relic Capacity
Relic Capacity.description: Relic Capacity A Magi-Knight can only have a number of Relics equal to their Reputation Level (minimum 1). If they acquire a Relic that would put them in excess of this number, they are allowed to carry the relic but not use it in any way.

Mystery of Relics.name: Mystery of Relics
Mystery of Relics.description: Mystery of Relics The power of a Relic should always be a mystery, waiting to be discovered by the Magi-Knight and squadron. Each one should be relatively unique and difficult to acquire. A Relic is capable of being something a Magi-Knight may regret acquiring, or it may have a useful purpose waiting to be discovered.

Identifying Relics.name: Identifying Relics
Identifying Relics.description:
Identifying Relics It is recommended that the Magic Keeper never reveal the full abilities of a Relic when found. Even successful Mysticism Skill Checks (DC 20) only offer vague clues and hints towards its purpose. Each step brings them closer to the creator's intent but should be gradually uncovered and revealed.

---

Example Relics

A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by.name: A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by Sirius Lee
A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by.description:
A Meeting on the Other Side, a Record by Sirius Lee

This book and others like it are journals or records that have conveniently escaped the notice of a Herald, whose duty is to remove evidence of Magi-Knights, Outsiders, and Elsewhere from the Cardinal Realm.

This unassuming book was written by Sirius Lee, a globe-trotting American antiquarian who lived during the 1920s. The pages are extremely difficult to read, having no index, chapter labels, and hastily transcribed cursive written during moments of fervor. This black, leather-bound book seems more akin to a lengthy journal or memoir.

Acquisition: Sold by Yoona's grandfather for part-time work at the shop or 5 Budget Tallies.

Contents: Details "Visitors from Beyond," solid walls morphing into skin-like plasticity, horrible screeches, esoteric concepts of other worlds, alternate realities, and bridges to those places.

#### Reading the Book

  • The book can be read during a small window of downtime. Each time read, mark 1 Reading Tally next to it (maximum once per day).
  • New Free Time Activity - Read the Record: Each time read as a Free Time Activity, mark 4 Reading Tallies.
  • At 15 Reading Tallies, the record has been read in its entirety once. Erase all Reading Tallies.

    • #### Reading Completion Effects

    Complete 1st Reading:

  • The item becomes a Relic
  • Gain 2 Inspiration Points
  • Gain +1 Mysticism Bonus while possessing the record
  • Next Sleep Phase: Feverish Dreams Effect

    • Complete 2nd Reading:

  • Gain 2 Inspiration Points
  • Previous bonus becomes +2 Mysticism Bonus
  • Next two Sleep Phases: Feverish Dreams Effect

    • Complete 3rd Reading:

  • Gain 1 Inspiration Point and 2 Trauma Points
  • Previous bonus becomes +3 Mysticism Bonus
  • Become immune to Feverish Dreams Effect while possessing the book
  • Discover a hidden ritual written between the lines (Sirius Lee's Ritual)
  • Gain access to Free Time Activity: Sirius Lee's Ritual

    • #### Sirius Lee's Ritual

  • Involves drawing unknown symbols on a 20x20-foot area, plus a large arcane circle, and utterance of complex words by up to 5 people
  • Mysticism DC 20: Determines this is Spectral Script
  • Mysticism DC 25: Determines the words are Spectral Tongue (romanized)
  • Completing the Ritual: Mysticism Skill Check (DC 18)
- Failure: Can attempt again later with no ill effects - Success: Large explosion of energy from the arcane circle. The relic becomes an Indestructible Relic, then nothing else occurs. Record "Completed Sirius' Ritual" and whether you participated.

Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic but gain no Gloom Gems (unless it has become Indestructible).

Spiral Disc.name: Spiral Disc
Spiral Disc.description:
Spiral Disc

This Relic comes from an area of densely concentrated Inert Spectral Energy and forms when a previously destroyed Spectral Tether reopens slightly. Time has worn down the suture, and corruptive energy from Elsewhere seeps back through.

These discs can form from any solid object: stone, wood, minerals, or bone. They contain a piece of the cosmos within them and always display incredible vistas of nebulas and spiraling galaxies. Staring into one has both restorative and calming effects, granting brief moments of enlightenment and inspiration. However, it brings the viewer closer to the call of Elsewhere due to the Invading Evil's corruptive influence.

#### Effects

New Free Time Activity - Gaze Into the Disc: After gazing into the disc for an entire activity with no social interaction:

  • Reduce Exhaustion Points to 0
  • Reduce Stress Points to 0
  • Gain 1 Inspiration Point
  • Gain 1 Corruption Point
Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic. Each member gains 10 Gloom Gems.

---

Ring of Calling.name: Ring of Calling
Ring of Calling.description:
Ring of Calling

This ring is a type of magical communication device with similarities to a Magi-Knight's Long-Range Communicator. It uses a powerful psychic connection to summon the aspect of a creature it is connected to into the wearer's dreams - in deep sleep or even daydreams. Unlike standard communicators, the Ring of Calling allows the wearer and connected creature to convey emotions, thoughts, and sensations, even across different planes of existence.

#### Effects

  • Sleep Connection: While wearing this ring, whenever you sleep, you are psychically linked to its creator.
  • Ring Detection: After communion with its creator, the ring intermittently vibrates gently when other Rings of Calling (connected to the same Nemesis Outsider or Harbinger) are within 1-mile radius. It can pinpoint another ring within 50-foot radius.
  • Cannot Be Removed: Once put on, this ring cannot be voluntarily removed except:
    • - After connection established: A Herald or Magi-Knight who passes Mysticism DC 20 can remove it. This irrevocably destroys the ring and creates an area of Spectral Energy. - When the wearer loses mystical powers (Cultist defeat or Magi-Knight death)
  • Additional Properties: Rings attached to particularly powerful entities could have additional unlisted properties.
Destruction: The squadron can collectively decide to destroy this Relic. Each member gains 5 Gloom Gems.

---

Relic of Skill Improvement.name: Relic of Skill Improvement
Relic of Skill Improvement.description:
Relic of Skill Improvement

This Relic typically takes the form of a small crystal that attaches to its owner's Soul Crystal once acquired, remaining active even when not transformed. The design is relatively simple but origins vary greatly. This Relic is highly adaptable, with areas of improvement constantly fluctuating until a Herald focuses energy to stop the magic from shifting.

#### Skill Improvement Table

Upon receiving, roll 1d20 (cannot be modified). At the beginning of every Episode, reroll and change the Skill Improvement to match.

d20TypeBonus
1-9Relic of Skill SupportYour lowest Skill (choice if tied) receives +1 bonus
10-19Relic of Skill ExpertiseYour highest Skill (choice if tied) receives +1 bonus
20Relic of Skill AscensionBoth lowest and highest Skills receive +1 bonus
#### Permanence During the Sleep Phase, exchange 50 Gloom Gems with the Herald to prevent ever having to roll again. The benefits become permanent.

Destruction: The owner can destroy this Relic at any time and gain 50 Gloom Gems (or 75 Gloom Gems if it has Permanence).
